name: Grauzone Festival

config_properties.name: Grauzone Festival
config_properties.description: A post-punk and darkwave festival in The Hague, Netherlands, featuring underground and alternative artists.

ai_profile:
**Grauzone Festival 2026: A Celebration of Bold Sounds and Diverse Voices**  

The Grauzone Festival 2026 continues its tradition of showcasing a rich tapestry of alternative music, hosting an impressive lineup of 70 artists spanning 40+ genres. With a strong focus on darkwave (12 artists), post-punk (9), and electronic (7), the festival remains a haven for fans of boundary-pushing sounds. Other notable genres such as techno, synthpop, industrial, and shoegaze add depth to the program, while niche styles like italo disco, noise rock, and coldwave ensure that every corner of the underground is represented. The inclusion of 11 DJs further highlights Grauzone’s commitment to blending live performances with electronic experimentation.  

This year’s lineup reflects a truly international scope, with artists from 17 countries. France leads the way with 13 acts, followed by the USA (11), the Netherlands (9), and the UK (6), while countries such as Japan, Morocco, and Mexico bring global flavors to the festival. Gender diversity also takes center stage, with a mix of male (22), female (18), and mixed-gender (10) acts, as well as the inclusion of non-binary representation. Furthermore, artists of color make up a notable portion of the lineup, emphasizing Grauzone’s dedication to amplifying underrepresented voices in the alternative music scene.  

With an average audience rating of 8.03, Grauzone Festival 2026 promises an exceptional experience for music enthusiasts. The festival’s embrace of eclectic genres, global perspectives, and diverse identities positions it as a vital and progressive event in the alternative music landscape, celebrating both the familiar and the avant-garde.
